pr_title: CB-5734 Introduce Load Based Alert Endpoint

timeline.bodyText: Is this new check valid for the other alert types?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: yes adjustmentType needs to be defined for any policy. added LOAD_BASED for LoadAlert
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Not in case of Cron, AdjustmentType.PERCENTAGE or AdjustmentType.NODE_COUNT -> (-20%). Shrink by 20%.
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: correct, removed the 'Positive' validation.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: What does this 'id' represent? Will this be different from the 'id' inside the ScalingPolicyResponse object? Or is this the AlertId vs PolicyId?
timeline.author: sidseth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -48,19 +45,11 @@ public void setId(Long id) {
         this.id = id;

replies.bodyText: Yes this is AlertId vs PolicyId
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText:
Not exactly related to the review.

What format TimeZone is supported?
What format CRON expressions supported. It looks like the code allows expressions with a minimum of 3 entries.
These will eventually need to be documented.
Also will eventually need to add more error validation for the TimeZone, and other fields in general.
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: As of now there is validation for CRON expression when TimeAlert is set, I have added for TimeZone also.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: This error message is nice. However, when we start working with CRNs - this becomes problematic. This shouldn't show up to the end user. Are there other scenarios where this happens as well?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: This can happen only when a deleted alert id is used to update.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText:
From your mail, I think CRN based error messages are better.
Another option may be more structured error responses which can be parsed by the CDP layer, and converted to actual errors. The CRN approach should be good for now.
replies.author: sidseth

timeline.bodyText: May be worth adding a node here that this essentially breaks updates to metric / prometheus alerts (Yes - these will be disabled, but for future fixes - if someone decides to go update them)
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: ack
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Does this mean 'One Load Alert per Cluster', or 'One Alert per cluster' or something else?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: This has to be ManytoOne, changed it.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText: What does it meant though. The JPA annotations are very confusing.
replies.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: There can be many LoadAlerts(One Per HostGroup if configured) for single cluster.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Add a Json text field for Configuration? Can be populated with defaults, or left empty for now.
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: The other fields related to LoadAlert are Min,Max,CoolDown. Since these applies to other type of alerts, I thought it is better to add hostGroup Level config for these three. For load alert specific config, i have added scaleUpMode (Normal, Aggressive) and scaleDownMode  (Normal, Aggressive) and storing it as a string itself in db.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText:
Why I say json is that we don't necessarily know what these fields will be. For the current algo, it's probably aggressiveness as a value between 0 and 1 (fraction / percentage).
If the algorithm changes, the parameters can be very different.
replies.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: ack
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: List for future enhancements?, where load alerts may be set on different hostgroups on a single cluster?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: All the loadalerts associated with various hostgroups is already retrieved.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText: Was asking why a 'List' instead of a single LoadAlert.
replies.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: It is a list since LoadAlerts can be configured one per HostGroup with different algorithms and maybe aggressiveness.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: What had we finalized on in terms of specifying minSize, maxSize and coolDown for Load Based only, or for Time Based as well?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: There was no finalization in this aspect, so i added to LoadBased based on the external api interface.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Extending AbstractAlertJson means the 'alertName' is present in LoadAlertConfigurationRequest as well as LoadAlertRequest. Also the description being repeated.
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: ack
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: How would these relate to the ScalingConfigurationRequest that exists in the DistroXAutoscaleClusterRequest?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: ScalingConfigurationRequest is at cluster level, and this can be overriding value for the alert. If not this can be removed and the cluster level value be used.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText:
I would say remove ScalingConfigurationRequest rather than this.
Actually, ScalingConfigurationRequest could be changed to allow users to configure aspects like

If scaling up, max number of nodes to add in one 'scale-up' event. (This is hardcoded to 100 in CB at the moment.

Anyway, I'd remove it for now.
replies.author: sidseth

timeline.bodyText:
AutoScalingMode being at the top level means a single cluster can only have a single AutoScalingMode for each host group.
At the moment, this doesn't matter since there is only one hostGroup to scale out. However, the interface allows for multiple Time or Load based policies - so it is partly catering to future requirements, while disallowing some functionality that may be required in the future. Can this be flipped to pull the hostGroup up - similar to 'https://github.infra.cloudera.com/sseth/thunderhead/blob/master/services/libs/protocols-yaml/src/main/yaml/datahub.yaml#L1754'. That does not disallow different host groups from having different types of scaling configs. It doesn't necessarily enable potential future functionality like Spot instance ratios, but does not block it out either. (For Spot - the thought was to specify hostGroups, and then a ratio within that single policy block).
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: Based on all our discussions and even the UI spec I assumed only one type of AutoScaling will be supported for a single cluster with different policies for different hostGroups. This also ensures efficient loading of clusters and avoids full table scans.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText:
Replied in the separate email thread; adding that here as well.
The current release supports a single type. The API should not disallow it though, for future enhancements. The UI will typically offer a simpler set of options compared to what is possible via the CLI or API - which tends to always be richer.
replies.author: sidseth

timeline.bodyText: State and Stack_Type - Is it possible to make these Enums? Not sure what they mean, and what the valid values are.
timeline.author: sidseth

timeline.bodyText: ScalingConfigurarationResponse? (Likely identical to ScalingConfigurationRequest - but should still be a separate class), or maybe just name the object ScalingConfiguration.
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: All Request and Response are identical except they have DB ID in response, the naming convention and converter conventions is based on existing class hierarchy.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: LoadAlertConfigurationRequest and LoadAlertConfigurationResponse are identical. Should be a single base class from which they inherit. Alternately, can be replaced by a 'LoadAlertConfiguration'
timeline.author: sidseth

+package com.sequenceiq.periscope.api.model;

replies.bodyText: same as above. have kept in sync with existing hierarchy we can refactor all request\responses\converters in a later PR if required.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Similarly here. The only difference between the Request and Response is the 'id' in the response. Base class + inherit?
timeline.author: sidseth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+package com.sequenceiq.periscope.api.model;

timeline.bodyText: General question: This and AutoScaleClusterV1Controller - Is there some specific reason to move the conversion (domain (or DB) to model (API) from the Service over to the Controller?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: Yes expect this class all other service api retrieve domain model only. The same domain model can be converted to different types of response objects in the controller, hence it was refactored.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: What is the significance of this?, and potential alternate values?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: There are DATALAKE, TEMPLATE type clusters also.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Would a name need to be associated with each of the cron expressions? (Can be auto-generated if required)
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: name is nullable.
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Skip this? Set the fields in the constructor itself, so that they can be 'final'
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: There is checkstyle limit on constructor to 5 executable statements hence had to refactor
replies.author: smaniraju

timeline.bodyText: Same as previous - significance of the 'stackType' field? Why was it not required earlier when the id was being used?
timeline.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: It was not required in earlier CB, but since now we differentiate DataHub clusters and Datalake clusters this is required whether id based or crn based.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText: Sounds good.
replies.author: sidseth
